评论概述: Durable, Comfortable, and Perfect for Work
评论详情: The Dickies Men's Original 874 Work Pants are a must-have for anyone who needs reliable workwear! 💪 The durable fabric holds up against daily wear and tear, even in tough work environments. They’re comfortable with a relaxed fit, providing enough room to move without feeling baggy. The sturdy construction ensures they won’t rip or tear easily, which is essential for long days on the job.  I love the classic style—these pants are professional enough for a work setting but also casual enough for everyday use. The wrinkle-resistant material is another bonus, meaning I don’t have to spend extra time ironing. They fit true to size and have a slightly tapered leg for a more modern look.  If you’re looking for high-quality, long-lasting work pants that can handle anything your day throws at you, these are a great choice. Highly recommend them for anyone who needs tough, comfortable pants for work or casual wear!

评论概述: Tight around waste, stiff and zero flex
评论详情: I know these are old school classic pants, and they certainly do have a good look. I have enjoyed them in the past but the waist is so tight and so high up that I have to go 2 sizes bigger which makes the legs super baggy. Also I can’t blame the stiffness because they don’t claim to be stretchy, but still, there is zero stretch when you try to use them in real working conditions like construction or trades. Wish they fit better and had more flexibility because they are handsome pants.

评论概述: fit like dickies, felt like dickies
评论详情: i like the range of motion and the feeling of these dickies flex fits. price was good. it seems like this fabric sheds goatheads, foxtails, cocaburs and the prarie stickers better than blue jeans in the wash. these jeans usually last me about 5 years. strong double stitching. these jeans also wick more moisture than regular blue jeans.

I recently bought two pairs of Dickies khakis to see how they compare to Dockers, my usual brand. I like some of the Dickies features, like the wider belt loops. I ordered the same size as my Dockers, 33x32, but was shocked at how tight they were around the waist.  Checking the Dickies page on Walmart, I found a warning to consider sizing up. They even have a tool where you enter the size you wear in other brands, and it suggests the equivalent Dickies size. For me, it recommended 35x32 based on my Dockers. Unfortunately, Dickies doesn't seem to make a 35-inch waist, and 36 seems way too big.  So, I returned to Amazon and ordered a 34x32. This time, before removing any tags, I'll compare them to a pair of my well-fitting Dockers to make sure the size is right.
